title: US reinstates death penalty for 9/11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed
US boosts Israeli defence with warships and aircraft amid Iranian threats
Kyle Rittenhouse says he won't vote for Trump. 12 hours later, he's 100% behind MAGA
content: "I am confident he will be the strong ally gun owners need to defend our Second Amendment rights...I'm 100% behind Donald Trump and encourage every gun owner to join me in helping send him back to the White House," Kyle Rittenhouse said 12 hours after he announced that he won't vote for Trump and Trump has bad advisers on Second Amendment.
summary: "I am confident he will be the strong ally gun owners need to defend our Second Amendment rights...I'm 100% behind Donald Trump and encourage every gun owner to join me in helping send him back to the White House," Kyle Rittenhouse said 12 hours after he announced that he won't vote for Trump and Trump has bad advisers on Second Amendment.

title: After row over kissing sports minister, Macron viral for old photo with Imane Khelif
content: ​Amid the controversy, French president Emmanuel Macron's photo with Imane Khelif went viral social media users asking whether Macron was a fan of the Algerian boxer. The photo dates back to 2022, according to the social media posts. Macron and Imane Khelif seem to have a lot of chemistry," a post that shared the video read adding that Macron in 2022 told Imane that if she reached the final of the Olympics in Paris, he will come to support her.
summary: ​Amid the controversy, French president Emmanuel Macron's photo with Imane Khelif went viral social media users asking whether Macron was a fan of the Algerian boxer. The photo dates back to 2022, according to the social media posts. Macron and Imane Khelif seem to have a lot of chemistry," a post that shared the video read adding that Macron in 2022 told Imane that if she reached the final of the Olympics in Paris, he will come to support her.

title: Harris campaign says it raised $310m in July, more than double Trump's haul
content: Neither campaign disclosed precisely how much of the money was raised or held by the campaigns themselves versus their allied party committees.
summary: Neither campaign disclosed precisely how much of the money was raised or held by the campaigns themselves versus their allied party committees.

title: US state mayor accused of minor's rape, arrested on third-degree charges
content: Misty Clanton Roberts, the former mayor of DeRidder, Louisiana, was arrested on charges of third-degree rape and contributing to the delinquency of a juvenile. She was later released after posting a $75,000 bond. The accusations stem from claims of sexual relations with a minor during her tenure. Roberts resigned a week before her arrest, maintaining her innocence.
summary: Misty Clanton Roberts, the former mayor of DeRidder, Louisiana, was arrested on charges of third-degree rape and contributing to the delinquency of a juvenile. She was later released after posting a $75,000 bond. The accusations stem from claims of sexual relations with a minor during her tenure. Roberts resigned a week before her arrest, maintaining her innocence.

title: US recognises Maduro's rival as winner; Uruguay and Argentina follow suit
content: The announcement, by secretary of state Antony Blinken, comes despite a claim by the country's authoritarian president, Nicolas Maduro, and by the govt-controlled electoral body, that Maduro had won the Sunday election.
summary: The announcement, by secretary of state Antony Blinken, comes despite a claim by the country's authoritarian president, Nicolas Maduro, and by the govt-controlled electoral body, that Maduro had won the Sunday election.

title: Anti-government rallies in Bangladesh seek justice for quota protest victims
US Secret Service chief says local police not responsible for Trump shooting
content: "In no way should any state or local agency supporting us in Butler on July 13th be held responsible for a Secret Service failure," US Secret Service Acting Director Ronald Rowe told reporters on Friday. "This was a Secret Service failure. That roof line should have been covered - we should have had better eyes on (that)."
summary: "In no way should any state or local agency supporting us in Butler on July 13th be held responsible for a Secret Service failure," US Secret Service Acting Director Ronald Rowe told reporters on Friday. "This was a Secret Service failure. That roof line should have been covered - we should have had better eyes on (that)."

title: When JD Vance was asked whether he had a secret family in Alaska in front of his wife
content: ​​"Oh by the way, if I did I am not gonna admit it in front of my wife. It's one of those questions where if you got to that point in your life that you are such a dishonest person and have a secret family in Alaska, I think they would hide it. But no, I don't have a secret family in Alaska," Vance said laughing adding that they ask all these weird questions to prepare for the media firestorm.
summary: ​​"Oh by the way, if I did I am not gonna admit it in front of my wife. It's one of those questions where if you got to that point in your life that you are such a dishonest person and have a secret family in Alaska, I think they would hide it. But no, I don't have a secret family in Alaska," Vance said laughing adding that they ask all these weird questions to prepare for the media firestorm.

title: Kamala Harris secures enough delegate votes to be Democrat presidential nominee, says she will officially accept next week
Van driver arrested after crashing into gates outside Irish prime minister's office in Dublin
content: In Dublin, a driver was arrested for crashing his van into the gates of several government buildings, including the residences of Ireland's president and the prime minister, early Friday morning. The incidents, which occurred around 2 a.m., resulted in no injuries.
summary: In Dublin, a driver was arrested for crashing his van into the gates of several government buildings, including the residences of Ireland's president and the prime minister, early Friday morning. The incidents, which occurred around 2 a.m., resulted in no injuries.

title: US justice department sues TikTok, accusing the company of violating a children's online privacy law
content: The Justice Department sued TikTok, accusing it of violating children's online privacy laws and breaking a previous settlement with the FTC. The lawsuit focused on allegations that TikTok collected personal information from children under 13 without parental consent. TikTok's failure to comply with COPPA led to millions of children accessing the regular app, exposing them to adult content.
summary: The Justice Department sued TikTok, accusing it of violating children's online privacy laws and breaking a previous settlement with the FTC. The lawsuit focused on allegations that TikTok collected personal information from children under 13 without parental consent. TikTok's failure to comply with COPPA led to millions of children accessing the regular app, exposing them to adult content.

title: Kamala sounds like a third grader...': VP's 'word salad' on diplomacy slammed. Vance says...
content: "This is just an extraordinary testament to the importance of having a president who understands the power of diplomacy and understands the strength that rests in understanding the significance of diplomacy and strengthening alliances," Kamala Harris said. Republicans said this is what Kamala sounds like when there is no script for her.
summary: "This is just an extraordinary testament to the importance of having a president who understands the power of diplomacy and understands the strength that rests in understanding the significance of diplomacy and strengthening alliances," Kamala Harris said. Republicans said this is what Kamala sounds like when there is no script for her.

title: Everything, and nothing, is black and white in US elections
content: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.
summary: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.

title: Trump says Zuckerberg called, apologized for 'censoring' photo: 'He's not gonna support a Democrat'
content: "First he called me after the incident (assassination bid) and said it was very brave. He actually announced he is not gonna support a Democrat because he can't because he respected me for what I did that day. What I did that day was a normal response to me. But I was called by Mark Zuckerberg yesterday, the day before on the same subject and he actually apologized and said that he had made a mistake..."Trump said adding that nobody called from Google.
summary: "First he called me after the incident (assassination bid) and said it was very brave. He actually announced he is not gonna support a Democrat because he can't because he respected me for what I did that day. What I did that day was a normal response to me. But I was called by Mark Zuckerberg yesterday, the day before on the same subject and he actually apologized and said that he had made a mistake..."Trump said adding that nobody called from Google.

title: 'If a leader leaves, another will arise': Hamas chief Haniyeh's last words before assassination in Israeli strike
content: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in an Israeli strike in Tehran after quoting a Koranic verse to Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei. His death marks the third assassination of a Hamas leader by Israel in two decades. Haniyeh advocated resistance against Israel and strengthened Hamas' ties with Iran to bolster military capabilities.
summary: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in an Israeli strike in Tehran after quoting a Koranic verse to Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei. His death marks the third assassination of a Hamas leader by Israel in two decades. Haniyeh advocated resistance against Israel and strengthened Hamas' ties with Iran to bolster military capabilities.

title: Watch: Biden says 'you're stuck with me for another 100, 90 days'. 'There's no way out
content: As President Joe Biden and vide president Kamala Harris welcomed the three freed hostages from Russia, Biden told reporters 'you're stuck with me as president for a while, kid'. "There's no way out, OK? You've got me for at least another 100, 90 days or so," Biden said when he was asked how important it was to secure the release as he is not running for re-election.
summary: As President Joe Biden and vide president Kamala Harris welcomed the three freed hostages from Russia, Biden told reporters 'you're stuck with me as president for a while, kid'. "There's no way out, OK? You've got me for at least another 100, 90 days or so," Biden said when he was asked how important it was to secure the release as he is not running for re-election.

title: UK police brace for planned far-right protests
content: UK police prepared for more far-right protests after a mass stabbing killed three young girls in Southport. Security tightened at mosques due to fears of anti-Islamic attacks. Prime Minister Starmer condemned agitators and promised legal action. Demonstrations are expected across various cities, including London and Cardiff, with authorities ready to respond.
summary: UK police prepared for more far-right protests after a mass stabbing killed three young girls in Southport. Security tightened at mosques due to fears of anti-Islamic attacks. Prime Minister Starmer condemned agitators and promised legal action. Demonstrations are expected across various cities, including London and Cardiff, with authorities ready to respond.

title: 'Disappointing...disgusting': Donald Trump's son on cousin's book; Mary shuts him down
content: Donald Trump's son Eric Trump said it's disappointing that Fred decided to 'cash in' less than 100 days before the election. Eric said his father Donald Trump provided endless financial support to Fred for his son's treatment but Fred decided to forget everything for some quick buck. Fred's journey down memory lane includes when he heard uncle Donald to say the N word, when uncle told him that he should let his disabled son die and then move to Florida etc. Fred also said he would vote for Kamala Harris as his uncle is 'atomic crazy'.
summary: Donald Trump's son Eric Trump said it's disappointing that Fred decided to 'cash in' less than 100 days before the election. Eric said his father Donald Trump provided endless financial support to Fred for his son's treatment but Fred decided to forget everything for some quick buck. Fred's journey down memory lane includes when he heard uncle Donald to say the N word, when uncle told him that he should let his disabled son die and then move to Florida etc. Fred also said he would vote for Kamala Harris as his uncle is 'atomic crazy'.
